sentence.idiomatic: I don't have time to go to the meeting.
Do you have time to talk? Yes.
Ms. Wang has time to read.
I would like to meet with you.
Ms. Li would not like to meet with him.
Would you like to watch a movie with me? OK.
I like to sing and also to dance.
Mr. Li needs to go to Shanghai and also Beijing.
What else is there?
I can't get through your phone.
Has she gotten through to Ms. Wang on the phone? No.
I got through to Mr. Li on the telephone.
No one is answering your phone.
Is anyone answering the phone? Ms. Li is answering it.
Please answer the phone.
My telephone number has changed.
Did your address change? No.
Mr. Wang doesn't want to change his phone number.
I'll send you a text message tomorrow.
When will you send me an e-mail? The day after tomorrow.
Mr. Li sent a fax to Mr. Zhang.
Did you get the e-mail? I got it.
Ms. Wang is receiving the e-mail.
I didn't receive your e-mail.
I have no ways to use the e-mail.
Do you have a way to call him? Yes.
He has a way to find Mr. Wang.
Are you free? Yes.
Ms. Wang is not free to watch a movie.
When are you free?
Please contact Mr. Wang.
When will you contact him?
Have you gotten in touch with Ms. Wang?
I'll help you to arrange it.
He helped me to finish my homework.
Can you help me?
I'll chat with you again later.
Have you met Ms. Li before? No, I haven't.
We'll meet again in three days.
Hello? Mr. Li. Long time no see. I'm sorry that lately I haven't had the time to see you. How are you doing?
Hello. Don't worry about it. I called you three times. Once I couldn't get through and twice no one answered.
Sorry. I've changed my telephone number. My new number is 6344-5598.
I sent you an email the day before yesterday. Did you get it?
Recently I haven't had any ways to check my e-mail. What’s the matter?
When do you have time? I'd like to speak with you.
In that case contact my secretary. She can help you to arrange a time.

word.literal: then let it be this way

sentence.idiomatic: Okay. We’ll do that. I'll chat with you later on. Goodbye.

word.literal: to dial, but not get through
